actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend chapter 31 of Title 28, United States Code, with respect to the litigation authority of the Attorney General, and for other purposes.
short_title: Department of Justice Litigation Policy Oversight Act

summary.text: Department of Justice Litigation Policy Oversight Act - Directs the Attorney General to: (1) submit a copy of any agreement with another agency which affects the litigation authority of the Department of Justice to the congressional judiciary committees 60 days before the effectiveness of such agreement; (2) resolve all legal disputes between two or more agencies (absent other specific statutory authority); (3) submit comments to such committees on proposed legislation which affects the litigation authority of the Department; (4) submit to such committees, with respect to litigation in which the ability of the Department to represent U.S. interests is impeded by existing law, a description of the problem and legislative recommendations upon completion of the litigation; and (5) report annually to such committees on the status of litigation authority and coordinating efforts undertaken.

titles.title: Department of Justice Litigation Policy Oversight Act
A bill to amend chapter 31 of Title 28, United States Code, with respect to the litigation authority of the Attorney General, and for other purposes.
